crap.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: something someone says that you think is completely wrong or untrue
crap.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: You don’t believe all that crap, do you?
Greg’s full of crap  (=often says things that are completely wrong).
That’s a bunch of crap! I never said that.
He came out with a load of crap about how he’d tried to call me yesterday.
Just cut the crap and tell me what really happened.
crap.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: something that is very bad or is of bad quality
crap.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: They sell a lot of stuff cheap, but most of it is crap.
The game was a load of crap.
crap.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: things that are useless or unimportant
crap.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: What is all this crap doing on my desk?
crap.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I don’t need this kind of crap  (=used when you are angry about the way someone is behaving towards you).
I’m tired of you giving me crap  (=saying bad things) about my long hair.
I’m not going to take any more of this crap!
crap.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: solid waste that is passed from your bowels
crap.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: the act of passing solid waste from your bowels
take a crap (also have a crap British English)
crap.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I’ve had such a crap day.
crap.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to pass waste matter from your bowels
